graphicalElements.text: A club member approaches the bar with a friend. You are not sure if they have been drinking debfore and what ehir state is... How do you approach them?
Not bad! To improve this, try involving the friend in the conversation to help assess his level of intoxication too.
Consider creating a better connection with your customers to assess their sobriety.
As a bartender it's good to get to know the friend too. Your conversations can help confirm if he's intoxicated.
You've just broken the law! Offering any drinks to intoxicated customers is not permitted!
Keep the conversation going is a great stratedy. A smart move here would be to also engage Nate's friend to assess his state.
Talking directly and listening to the person who appears intoxicated helps you assess his state.
Talking directly and listening to the person who appears intoxicated helps you assess his state.
You mastered it! You've been professional explaining your descision is based on the law.
You could be issued fine or penalty! When customers are intoxicated you can't serve food or water. The law requires them to leave immediately.
To make this response even better you should explain you are following the law.
Stating it's the law and offering to arrange transport home is great! Next time explain some of the consequences. This would be more convincing and emphatic.
A vague response can be confusing and upsetting. It's best to explain it's the law and you could be issued a fine or other penalty.
Perfect response! Make them aware of the law and consequences.
Threatening to call the police could escalate the situation. Simply explaining it's the law and you must follow it would prevent this.
It's good you stay calm as that prevents the situation from escalating! You could be more precise mentioning what consequences their actions may cause.
